page.title: 13HISTORY AROUND CARSPHAIRN
page.content: {CARNAVEL}Near the farm are the remains of a neolithic long cairn and some round Bronze Age cairns.The ancient route to the Solway through Galloway can still be followed over the hill above the farm. {CHURCH}The present church was built in 1815 and an unusual central communion table can be seen inside. {VILLAGE}The history of the village can be traced back to at least 1635, when Charles I granted a charter to Robert Grierson of Lag, making the Kirktoun of Carsphairn into a Burgh.In 1671 the charter was renewed by Charles II. By it, Carsphairn was entitled to elect bailies, build a tolbooth, erect a cross, create burgesses, have a weekly market, and have two annual fairs. (History of Lands & their Owners Vol. III).It is possible that the Show held now, is a relic of the charter.
